      • getManhattanDistance

        public static int getManhattanDistance(org.bukkit.Location b1,
                                       org.bukkit.Location b2,
                                       boolean checkY)
        Calculates the so-called 'Manhatten Distance' between two locations
        This is the distance between two points without going diagonally
        Parameters:
        b1 - location
        b2 - location
        checkY - state, True to include the y distance, False to exclude it
        Returns:
        The manhattan distance

      • getMaterialBlock

        public static MaterialBlock getMaterialBlock(java.lang.String s)
        Tries to get a material from a string including meta (excluding it implies 0)

        1, STONE, stone, 1:0 all would return STONE (byte = 0)
        Parameters:
        s - the input string
        Returns:
        the MaterialBlock, NULL if it cannot parse.

      • getHighestPotionLevel

        public static int getHighestPotionLevel(org.bukkit.potion.PotionEffectType type,
                                        java.util.Collection<org.bukkit.potion.PotionEffect> pots)
        Gets the highest level of a type of potion from a list of potion effect objects
        Parameters:
        type - the potion effect type
        pots - the potions collection
        Returns:
        the level. This is one added to the amplifier. So if there are NO potion effects of that type, 0 is returned. However if the highest amplifier is 0, then 1 will be returned and so on.

      • getEntityLookingAt

        public static org.bukkit.entity.Entity getEntityLookingAt(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e,
                                                          double range,
                                                          double off)
        Get an entity that the supplied entity (e) is looking at with a specific range and offset
        Parameters:
        e - the entity
        range - the max range to check for. If this is less than 1, 1 will be used instead.
        off - the offeset. For example, if this is set to 2, then you cannot be looking at an entity if it is at least 3 or more blocks away from your target. If the offset is less than 1, 1 will be used instead
        Returns:
        an entity that the supplied entity (e) is looking at. If the supplied entity is not looking at an entity, or it does not meet the given ranges and offsets, null will be returned instead

      • isLookingAt

        public static boolean isLookingAt(org.bukkit.entity.Entity is,
                                  org.bukkit.entity.Entity at,
                                  double range,
                                  double off)
        Check if the given entity IS is looking at the given entity AT.
        Parameters:
        is - the entity
        at - the entity that IS should be looking at to return true
        range - the max range to check
        off - the max offset
        Returns:
        true if the entity IS is looking at the given entity AT
